result.execSummary:
The defendant Christain D. Mielke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, the defendant has three days credit for time served.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions. Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.
Defendant must maintain at least 25 hours of employment weekly or as directed by his agent.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle unless he has a valid driver's license and his agent approves  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

Defendant is to attend a National Safety Counsel safe driving course.  Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant may apply for expungement if all conditions of probation have been met and all costs are paid.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent. The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is do Community Service for a Non-Profit Organization which must be approved by his agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christain D. Mielke

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christain D. Mielke
Current: 504 South Main Street, Juneau, WI 53039 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: 200 E Krych St Apt 20, Thorp, WI 54771

1:12 PM Defendant Christain D. Mielke in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Christain D. Mielke.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin.   All TR's dismissed and read-in.  The defendant pled guilty to the charge. Rights given. Court finds that they have entered her plea knowingly, intelligently and of their own free will and finds the defendant guilty.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 03:10 pm.
Waived reading of Information  The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.

01:25 PM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Christain D. Mielke, appeared with Attorney Preston James Smead, both appeared by video.    Defendant waives his in person appearance and has no objection to appearing remotely.    Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

09:31 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Christain D. Mielke, appeared with Attorney Preston James Smead.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Not guilty entered to the TR's.    Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
